title: Publish final FAQ page copy verbatim on the in-app FAQ page

requirements.text: Update the in-app FAQ page (frontend/src/pages/FAQPage.tsx) so it displays the owner-provided “Xocial.Stream — FAQ” content exactly word-for-word (including punctuation, capitalization, and paragraph breaks), replacing all existing FAQ questions/answers and the page heading.

quotes: THIS IS OUR EXACT FAQ PAGE OK . I WANT EXACT WORD FOR WORD. DONT DARE CHANGE OR ADD ANYTHING TO IT . NOT A NUMBER OR A LETTER  DO YOU HEAR ME

acceptanceCriteria: The FAQ page H1 heading renders exactly: “Xocial.Stream — FAQ”

The FAQ accordion contains exactly these questions in this order, with answers displayed exactly as provided by the owner (no added/removed/rewritten text):
1) What is Xocial.Stream?
2) How is this different from YouTube or other platforms?
3) How does Xocial.Stream work?
4) Are my uploaded videos safe? Will I lose them if something crashes?
5) Can other people see my videos?
6) Do you compress my videos?
7) Are there upload limits?
8) What video formats can I upload?
9) What content is allowed on Xocial.Stream?
10) What if my video gets blocked?
11) How do I share my videos?
12) Can I delete my videos?
13) Can I cancel my subscription anytime?
14) Is there a mobile app?
15) What is the Internet Computer (ICP)?

All paragraph breaks and the upload-limits plan list (Free Plan / Pro / Creator Plus) appear as separate lines/paragraphs matching the provided text (no extra bullets, numbering, or formatting changes that alter the text)
No other FAQ content remains from the current FAQPage.tsx implementation

requirements.text: Add a lightweight safeguard in the FAQPage implementation so the FAQ content is stored as a single immutable in-file constant (single source of truth) and rendered from that constant, to reduce the risk of accidental partial edits or content drift during future UI refactors.

quotes: DONT DARE CHANGE OR ADD ANYTHING TO IT . NOT A NUMBER OR A LETTER

acceptanceCriteria: FAQ content is defined once (single constant) and rendered from that constant without re-typing the copy across multiple JSX fragments
No transformation logic (e.g., auto-trimming, auto-capitalization, markdown conversion) changes the literal displayed characters of the provided FAQ text

constraints: Do not modify the FAQ copy in any way (no rewriting, no additions, no deletions, no punctuation changes).
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Do not change any other static pages (Terms/Privacy/Support/Pricing/etc.).
Do not add new FAQ questions, sections, CTAs, or navigation items beyond rendering the provided FAQ text.
